articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: Federal Judge Deals Another Blow to Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Order
articles.description: The injunction issued Thursday by a judge in Seattle came a day after another injunction stemming from a lawsuit in Maryland.
articles.content:
For the second time this week, a federal judge has issued a nationwide preliminary injunction to block President Trump’s effort to end automatic citizenship for babies born on U.S. soil to undocumented immigrants.
The decision, handed down on Thursda... [638 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: NCAA Bars Transgender Athletes From Women’s Sports After Trump Order
articles.description: The decision, effective immediately, came a day after President Trump signed an order barring transgender girls and women from playing in women’s sports at federally funded educational institutions.
articles.content:
Only athletes who were assigned female at birth will be eligible to play women’s sports at N.C.A.A.-member colleges and universities, the organization announced on Thursday.
That decision, effective immediately, came a day after President Trump signe... [799 chars]

articles.description: In his military-industrial complex speech, Eisenhower didn't just target the Pentagon. He also singled out science and technology.

articles.title: Trump Pauses Online Tirade to Preach Unity
articles.description: At the National Prayer Breakfast in Washington, Mr. Trump took a moment to speak of bipartisan comity. Just hours earlier, he torched the federal bureaucracy, the global order, the media and Democrats.
articles.content:
Of all the many forms Donald J. Trump can take, maybe the most perplexing one is Pious Trump.

articles.title: Federal Workers Caught in the Crossfire: Trump's Buyout Stirring Controversy
articles.description: A U.S. judge has temporarily halted the Trump administration's controversial buyout plan for federal workers, offering hope to unions and opponents. The plan, which aims to reduce the federal workforce, has sparked legal challenges and protests. Over 60,000 federal employees have already accepted the buyout offer.

articles.author: CBC.ca
articles.title: Patriotic Ontario pilot creates massive maple leaf in the sky to send message to U.S.
articles.description: In a bit of fancy flying that was in equal measures patriotic, precise and polite, an Ontario pilot showed Donald Trump exactly what he thinks of the U.S. president's recent moves to challenge Canadian sovereignty.
articles.content:
London pilot Michael Jones took to the skies over southwestern Ontario and flew in the shape of a maple leaf on Feb. 5, 2025. The trip took 2 hours and 3 minutes, covering 426 km.
In a bit of fancy flying that was in equal measures patriotic, precise... [4179 chars]

articles.title: Famine Aid in Crisis: U.S. Aid Freeze Hampers Global Relief Efforts
articles.description: The Trump administration's pause on U.S. foreign aid is severely impacting global hunger relief systems. FEWS NET's shutdown and halted food shipments raise concerns over aid distribution as 500,000 tons of food remain stuck, affecting numerous lives. The implications of USAID's aid freeze challenge organizations worldwide to tackle food insecurity.
